com.nokia.maps.kml

Interface HotSpot


  • public interface HotSpot
    This interface represents the <hotSpot> tag from KML specification. It specifies the position within the Icon that is "anchored" to the <Point> specified in the <Placemark>.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ELEMENT
      This constant defines <hotSpot> as an XML element.
      static java.lang.String UNIT_FRACTION
      This constant indicates that the x or y units should be read as fraction of an image size.
      static java.lang.String UNIT_INSET_PIXELS
      This constant indicates that the x or y units should be read as pixels from the top and right hand corner.
      static java.lang.String UNIT_PIXELS
      This constant indicates that the x or y units should be read as pixels.
      static java.lang.String X
      This constant defines an XML attribute for the x co-ordinate of a hotspot.
      static java.lang.String X_UNITS
      This constant defines an XML attribute is indicating how the x co-ordinate of the hotspot should be read.
      static java.lang.String Y
      This constant defines an XML attribute for the y co-ordinate of a hotspot.
      static java.lang.String Y_UNITS
      This constant defines an XML attribute is indicating how the y co-ordinate of the hotspot should be read.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getX()
      This method retrieves the x offset co-ordinate.
      java.lang.String getxUnits()
      This method retrieves the units of the x co-ordinate.
      java.lang.String getY()
      This method retrieves the x offset co-ordinate.
      java.lang.String getyUnits()
      This method retrieves the units of the y co-ordinate.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        java.lang.String getX()
        This method retrieves the x offset co-ordinate.
        Returns:
        The Either the number of pixels, a fractional component of the icon, or a pixel inset indicating the x component of a point on the icon.

      • getY

        java.lang.String getY()
        This method retrieves the x offset co-ordinate.
        Returns:
        The Either the number of pixels, a fractional component of the icon, or a pixel inset indicating the y component of a point on the icon.

      • getxUnits

        java.lang.String getxUnits()
        This method retrieves the units of the x co-ordinate.
        Returns:
        The Units in which the x value is specified.

      • getyUnits

        java.lang.String getyUnits()
        This method retrieves the units of the y co-ordinate.
        Returns:
        The Units in which the y value is specified
